channel.title: Novint Falcon® Pistol Grip
channel.description:
Watch the video of it: [url='https://home.novint.com/products/pistol_grips.php']https://home.novint.com/products/pistol_grips.php[/url]
So what do you guys think? Do you think its worth the money? Or do you think its stupid for someone to buy it?

item.title: Novint Falcon® Pistol Grip
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
KMCA:

I still don’t see why that tech never caught on in the lazer tag area… then again if you want to feel the hits most people just go paintballing or speedballing

Because laser tag is geared towards all audiences, including children. I’m guessing the staff of laser tag doesn’t want to deal with 20 screaming children that got punched in the nuts by a vest that was just a little bit too big for them.

Read full topic

item.title: Novint Falcon® Pistol Grip
item.dc:creator: Lopez
item.description:
Winged One:

$190 is a bit steep… =/

Besides, looking around with that thing does seem awkward. It’s almost as if it’s backwards. Since it’s on a curve and if you push to the left, and then aim right as an effect, it doesn’t make sense for the game to turn left.

Yeah I get what you mean. From the videos however it seems as though you slide it from side to side (as though you were using a mouse from above) rather than rotate it.

Read full topic

item.title: Novint Falcon® Pistol Grip
item.dc:creator: KMCA
item.description:
Level:

Reminds me of that vest you wore during FPS games, that when you got shot, it’d hit you on your chest where you got shot, get shot in the back, get hit in the back IRL.

Why would you want to get beaten up by a computer? You’d get out of a gaming session and people would think you just got into a fight from all the bruises.

I still don’t see why that tech never caught on in the lazer tag area… then again if you want to feel the hits most people just go paintballing or speedballing

Read full topic

item.title: Novint Falcon® Pistol Grip
item.dc:creator: oscarxef11
item.description:
i think this would be awesome and is worth the money, but they need to come out with more than a pistol grip. I know the pistol grip is pretty realistic, but really- how much to you use pistols in fps games? i think something more along the lines on a rifle would be better, but probalby more expensive.

item.title: Novint Falcon® Pistol Grip
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
Ramirezoid:

Why don’t they just make mice with force-feedback?

Fixed.

Actually not a bad question, besides the point that (for most implementations I can think of) you could just lift it off the desk to defeat whatever mechanism was pushing against your hand.

item.title: Novint Falcon® Pistol Grip
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
In twenty years, maybe. These would be best off in video arcades (which don’t really exist anymore outside of Japan).

Why don’t they just make mice with vibration? Because you’ll stick it where it doesn’t belong.

It’d be interesting to have for the gravity Gun.

item.title: Novint Falcon® Pistol Grip
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
Nah, waste of money in my opinion. I doubt it’d improve my gaming performance over mouse and keyboard, and I’d feel like a tool waving that thing around in front of me at a screen.

Then again, I’m not exactly a hardcore gamer.

Read full topic

item.title: Novint Falcon® Pistol Grip
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
I demo’d this with COD4. It’s a lot of fun, but I have a hard time imagining a player using a Falcon would be competitive against a player using a mouse - its just less efficient. And it slides around a bit if you have heavy hands.

Also holding a pistol grip but not aiming down the sights doesn’t feel immersive to me.

Hamst3r:

I love the M+K combo, but M+Falcon combo seems ridiculous.

You mean K+Falcon? If I’m remembering right, you can push the falcon left and right while aiming straight to lean, but its still WASD to move - and I think thats the most effective way to do it.

Read full topic

item.title: Novint Falcon® Pistol Grip
item.dc:creator: Hamst3r
item.description:
I’ll probably get one in a few years if the price comes down and it looks like the support for it keeps happening.

Though, Instead of a pistol grip, I think a machine gun grip with a few buttons on the sides so you could center it and not use the keyboard would be awesome. I love the M+K combo, but M+Falcon combo seems ridiculous. The Falcon needs to be the sole control device.

For instance: Use linear movements to strafe and walk around. Tilt the gun to look around and turn. Rotate to lean left and right. A couple buttons on the side to switch weapons and activate stuff. Mentally, that seems like the proper way for it to work.

Read full topic
